refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The hb_draw_funcs_t struct can be used with hb_font_draw_glyph().

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_create ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_draw_funcs_t * hb_draw_funcs_create (void);
refsect2.para: Creates a new draw callbacks object.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A newly allocated hb_draw_funcs_t with a reference count of 1. The initial reference count should be released with hb_draw_funcs_destroy when you are done using the hb_draw_funcs_t. This function never returns NULL. If memory cannot be allocated, a special singleton hb_draw_funcs_t object will be returned.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_get_empty ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_draw_funcs_t * hb_draw_funcs_get_empty (void);
refsect2.para: Fetches the singleton empty draw-functions structure.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_reference ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_draw_funcs_t * hb_draw_funcs_reference (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs);
refsect2.para: Increases the reference count on dfuncs by one.
This prevents dfuncs from being destroyed until a matching call to hb_draw_funcs_destroy() is made.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_destroy ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_funcs_destroy (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs);
refsect2.para: Deallocate the dfuncs . Decreases the reference count on dfuncs by one. If the result is zero, then dfuncs and all associated resources are freed. See hb_draw_funcs_reference().

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_set_user_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_draw_funcs_set_user_data (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, hb_user_data_key_t *key, void *data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy, hb_bool_t replace);
refsect2.para: Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the specified draw-functions structure.

entry.para: A pointer to the user data
A callback to call when data is not needed anymore.
Whether to replace an existing data with the same key

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_get_user_data ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the user-data associated with the specified key, attached to the specified draw-functions structure.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A pointer to the user data.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_make_immutable ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_funcs_make_immutable (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs);

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_is_immutable ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_draw_funcs_is_immutable (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs);

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if dfuncs is immutable, false otherwise

refsect2.title: hb_draw_move_to_func_t ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*hb_draw_move_to_func_t) (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, void *draw_data, hb_draw_state_t *st, float to_x, float to_y, void *user_data);
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_draw_funcs_t to perform a "move-to" draw operation.

entry.para: The data accompanying the draw functions in hb_font_draw_glyph()
User data pointer passed to hb_draw_funcs_set_move_to_func()

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_set_move_to_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_funcs_set_move_to_func (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, hb_draw_move_to_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets move-to callback to the draw functions object.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_line_to_func_t ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*hb_draw_line_to_func_t) (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, void *draw_data, hb_draw_state_t *st, float to_x, float to_y, void *user_data);
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_draw_funcs_t to perform a "line-to" draw operation.

entry.para: The data accompanying the draw functions in hb_font_draw_glyph()
User data pointer passed to hb_draw_funcs_set_line_to_func()

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_set_line_to_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_funcs_set_line_to_func (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, hb_draw_line_to_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets line-to callback to the draw functions object.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

entry.para: The function to call when user_data is not needed anymore.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_cubic_to_func_t ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*hb_draw_cubic_to_func_t) (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, void *draw_data, hb_draw_state_t *st, float control1_x, float control1_y, float control2_x, float control2_y, float to_x, float to_y, void *user_data);
refsect2.para: A virtual method for the hb_draw_funcs_t to perform a "cubic-to" draw operation.

entry.para: The data accompanying the draw functions in hb_font_draw_glyph()
X component of first control point
Y component of first control point
X component of second control point
Y component of second control point
User data pointer passed to hb_draw_funcs_set_cubic_to_func()

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_set_cubic_to_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_funcs_set_cubic_to_func (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, hb_draw_cubic_to_func_t func, void *user_data, hb_destroy_func_t destroy);

entry.para: associated draw data passed by the caller

refsect2.title: hb_draw_close_path ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_draw_close_path (hb_draw_funcs_t *dfuncs, void *draw_data, hb_draw_state_t *st);

refsect2.title: HB_DRAW_STATE_DEFAULT
refsect2.programlisting: #define HB_DRAW_STATE_DEFAULT {0, 0.f, 0.f, 0.f, 0.f, {0.}, {0.}, {0.}}
refsect2.para: The default hb_draw_state_t at the start of glyph drawing.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_funcs_t
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct hb_draw_funcs_t hb_draw_funcs_t;
refsect2.para: hb_draw_move_to_func_t, hb_draw_line_to_func_t and hb_draw_cubic_to_func_t calls are necessary to be defined but we translate hb_draw_quadratic_to_func_t calls to hb_draw_cubic_to_func_t if the callback isn't defined.

refsect2.title: hb_draw_state_t

entry.para: Whether there is an open path
X component of the start of current path
Y component of the start of current path
